H0.text: Mitochondrion is a structure that a rabbit cell and a bacillus cell have in common.

H1.text: Capsule is the structure that rabbit cells and bacillus cells have in common.

H2.text: The nucleus is the structure that a rabbit cell and a bacillus cell have in common.

H3.text: DNA is the structure that both a rabbit cell and a bacillus cell possess.

A4.text: Prokaryotes store their DNA only in the cytoplasm, in circular chromosomes, while within eukaryotic cells, DNA is organized into long structures called chromosomes.

A5.text: In prokaryotes, the DNA is held within an irregularly shaped body in the cytoplasm called the nucleoid, while eukaryotic organisms store most of their DNA inside the cell nucleus as nuclear DNA.
